result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon A. Eckes II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

Same as Ct#1
Concurrent with: Ct#1

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Froelich re: State and Defense agree to 286 days for Mr Eckes.
An initial appearance was never held on this case, but the court event has to be added to close the case.

10:28 a.m. Defendant Gordon A. Eckes in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - plead to Count 1 - time served.  Count 2 - state moves to dismiss by agreement of the parties.  Schwab agrees.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 and adjudicates defendant guilty.  Court dismisses Count 2.  Schwab asking for time served - 286 days or earned release program in the alterntive.  Froelich asking for DOC recommendations....convert balance of restitution to civil judgment. Court vacates dismissal of  Count 2. Count 2 is reinstated by agreement of all parties.     Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 2.  Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS .  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty  of Count 2.  Court orders 1 year in Pierce Co. Jail, credit for time served up to a year on both counts on 12CF163  and restitution to be reduced to civil judgment.  15CM62, S/W - Probation for 2 years on each count, concurrent, court costs of $243 on each count.  Additional condition of probation on Count 1 defendant will serve 4 months conditional jail time in the Pierce County Jail with work release priveleges, Count 2 - 20 days in Pierce County Jail, consecutive to 4 months.  Appeal rights given to defendant on each case.
Status conference at 02-22-2016 10:00 am.  DF in St. Croix Co. Jail, NOH mailed on 12CF163.

11:43 Defendant Gordon A. Eckes in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Donald J. Schwab appeared by phone means for Defendant Gordon A. Eckes. Attorney Schwab did not receive notice of hearing.  Hearing will be continued. Attorney Schwab will contact Court for scheduling.  Warrant on new case 15CM62 quashed.

10:27 AM 
Defendant Gordon A. Eckes not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
